name: Gluten-Free Fried Clams
author: Marcia
summary: Came up with this easy, gluten-free recipe to tame my craving for fried clams. They came out every bit as good as I remember having at seafood restaurants before my Celiac diagnosis. I like them with French fries, lemon or lime wedges, and tartar sauce or seafood cocktail sauce. Yum!
ingredients: ½ cup gluten-free all purpose baking flour
directions: Place shucked clams in a small bowl
Pour in milk; toss clams gently with a fork to cover evenly
Let soak in the refrigerator for 30 minutes
Combine flour,  , salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper in a plastic container with a lid
Seal container and shake to blend flour mixture
Remove clams one at a time from the milk and place in the flour mixture; shake gently to coat
Shake off excess flour and place on a plate
Heat 3/4 inch oil in a large saucepan or deep-fryer
Fry clams in small batches until golden brown and crispy, about 1 minute
Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate using a slotted spoon
